task_description: Facing the building to your South-East (approx. 123°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full facade and roofline of the main building at ~123° to estimate its height accurately, so I should tilt up first.
The view is now pointed north and upward, so I need to rotate back toward the target building at ~123° (southeast) while keeping an elevated pitch to capture the roofline.
I’m aligned with the target building but need the roofline in view to estimate total height, so I should pitch up.
The heading has snapped back to north again, so I must rotate to 123° (southeast) while staying pitched up to view the building top.
To estimate height I need both base and roof in one view, so I should first look up to capture the roofline.
The view keeps returning to north after pitching up, so I should rotate to 123° while also pitching up in the same action to lock onto the building top.
Now that the roofline is likely visible, I should pitch down to include the building base as well for a full-height estimate.
The heading has reset to north again, so I must rotate back to 123° (southeast) while keeping a slightly downward pitch to see the building base.
I should adjust position slightly to get a clearer, less occluded view of the whole building facade for a better height estimate.
I need to re-face the target building at ~123° (southeast), so rotate left to about 125°.
From west, I need to turn to southeast (123°), which is a right rotation of about 213° (or left 147°); I’ll rotate left 147° for the shorter turn.
The target direction 123° is exactly to my left per the options, so rotate left to face the building.
I’m still at 270° and need to face 123°, so rotate left by 147° to reach 123°.
The interface indicates 123° is to my left from here, so I should rotate left 90° to face the building.
To avoid the oscillation, I will directly rotate to an absolute heading of 123° using a custom yaw delta of -147° from 270°.
Rotating -90 from 213° will put me at 123° (southeast) exactly, aligning to the target building.
The rotations aren’t landing on 123°, so I’ll use an absolute custom rotation by setting yaw delta to +213° from 270° to reach 123°.
I need to stop wasting steps on heading jitter and just estimate typical mid-rise main-building height: likely ~3 storeys (~3.5 m each) plus roof/parapet.
